main.name: Leah King
main.description: The experiences that I've had in my career have made me who I am today. I am a person who builds relationships, can adapt to change, and I love learning and teaching others. I consider myself a creative soul and I love the process of using the screen as my canvas
main.bio: My path to becoming a full stack web developer has been an interesting one! My original carrer direction was law or social work but through a series of interesting turns I ended up with an MBA and being a minister - go figure that one! My background has provided me with lots of experience managing people and teams and I hope to  incorporate this into my tech career.  In addition to web development, I own an Etsy shop that specializes in kawaii stationary, washi tape and planner supplies. main.contactmessage: Thank you for taking time to visit my site. Let's connect!

resume.skillmessage: My skills include Agile Project Management, Asynchronous JavaScript, Authentication, Automated Unit Testing, Computer Architecture, Data Structures, Debugging, Deployment, End-to-End testing, ExpressJS, LESS, NodeJS, Postgres, Redux, Relational Databases, Teamwork and Collaboration

education.description: -Completed full-stack web development curriculum, and demonstrated mastery of content through weekly assessments; -Completed front-end and back-end projects during my web development portion of the curriculum; -Completed computer science curriculum, and demonstrated mastery of the content; -Completed Lambda Labs apprenticeship; -Passed final assessments and interview demonstrating my technical and professional proficiencies.
Accounting, Management, Finance, Leadership, Business Strategy, Organizational Behavior, Strategic Planning
Graduated Magna cum laude; member of Alpha Kappa Delta Honor Society

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
